item.title: キャンパス新聞による精査の結果、スタンフォード大学の学長は辞任し、ノースウェスタン大学のフットボールコーチは解雇された。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
After scrutiny by campus newspapers, Stanford's president is resigning and Northwestern's football coach was fired, showing the key role of student journalists  —  The president of Stanford and the head football coach at Northwestern left their positions after being scrutinized in campus newspapers.

item.title: 米下院司法委員会は23対0の賛成多数で、情報源の暴露を強制されないよう記者を保護するPRESS法の新バージョンを承認（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
In a 23-0 vote, the US House Judiciary Committee approves a new version of the PRESS Act, which would shield reporters from being forced to reveal sources  —  A bill to protect journalists from revealing their sources amid pressure from the federal government cleared the House Judiciary Committee in a unanimous vote on Thursday.

item.title: Netflix、2023年のフリーキャッシュフロー予測を$3.5Bから$5Bに引き上げ、ストライキによる「現金コンテンツ支出の減少」と「制作開始のタイミング」を理由に（Peter White/Deadline）
item.description:
Peter White / Deadline:
Netflix increases its free cash flow estimate for 2023 from $3.5B to $5B, citing “lower cash content spend” due to the strikes and “timing of production starts”  —  Netflix has found itself with cash to spend thanks to the writers and actors strike.

item.title: アトランタ・ジャーナル＝コンスティテューション』紙が、UGAフットボールチームに対する性的虐待の申し立てに関する記事で「我々の基準に満たない誤り」があったとして、アラン・ジャッドを解雇（グレン・ギルボー/OutKick）
item.description:
Glenn Guilbeau / OutKick:
The Atlanta Journal-Constitution fires Alan Judd following “errors that fell short of our standards” in a story on sex abuse claims against UGA's football team  —  The Atlanta Journal-Constitution did not fully retract a recent, critical story about the University …

item.title: ネットフリックス第2四半期：売上高は予想83億ドルに対し前年同期比2.7％増の82億ドル、純利益は予想3.3％増の15億ドル、新規契約者数は予想190万人に対し590万人、第3四半期予想は予想を下回る。(リサ・リッチワイン/ロイター)
item.description:
Lisa Richwine / Reuters:
Netflix Q2: revenue up 2.7% YoY to $8.2B, vs. $8.3B est., net income up 3.3% YoY to $1.5B, 5.9M net new subscribers, vs. 1.9M est., and a Q3 forecast below est.  —  Netflix Inc (NFLX.O) handily beat Wall Street earnings forecasts on Wednesday as a password-sharing crackdown …

item.title: 情報源ThreadsはInstagramのアルゴリズムをほぼ再現し、堅いニュースよりもクリエイターや友人の投稿を優先し、Instagramのモデレーターに依存している。
item.description:
Financial Times:
Sources: Threads uses a largely replicated Instagram algorithm, prioritizing creators' and friends' posts over hard news, and relies on Instagram moderators  —  Facebook's parent company downgrades current affairs on Threads app and refuses to engage with Canadian law designed to fund media groups

item.title: NBCとCBSが秋のテレビ番組スケジュールを変更、「LAW & ORDER」「Young Sheldon」などの新シーズンを延期、関係者はSAG-AFTRAよりも脚本家のストライキを非難（Tony Maglio/IndieWire）
item.description:
Tony Maglio / IndieWire:
NBC and CBS retool fall TV schedules, delaying new seasons for Law & Order, Young Sheldon, and more; a source blames the writers' strike more than SAG-AFTRA's  —  Bad news, dads of America: the five Dick Wolf shows previously set for NBC's fall schedule are all being removed due to the ongoing Hollywood strikes.

item.title: ツイッターでヘイトスピーチや誤報が増加との調査結果、リンダ・ヤカリーノCEOは「正しくない」とし、広告掲載規制などの改善をアピール（ブルームバーグ）
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Researchers say hate speech and misinformation on Twitter are up; CEO Linda Yaccarino says that's “incorrect” and touts improvements, like ad placement controls  —  Since Musk's takeover, a number of researchers see a rise in hate speech, violent content

item.title: 情報源Netflixは過去2週間に広告主に対し、同社の広告付きティアの米国加入者数は〜150万人、Huluの15年前の広告付きティアの米国加入者数は〜3000万人であると伝えた（Sahil Patel/The Information）。
item.description:
Sahil Patel / The Information:
Sources: Netflix told advertisers in the past two weeks that its ad-supported tier has ~1.5M US subscribers; Hulu's 15-year-old ad tier has ~30M US subscribers  —  Around 1.5 million people in the U.S. have signed up to pay for Netflix's tier of service that carries ads …

item.title: iHeartMediaがLinkedInと提携し、LinkedIn Podcast Network向けにビジネスポッドキャストの制作、配信、収益化を行う（Radio World）
item.description:
Radio World:
iHeartMedia partners with LinkedIn to produce, distribute, and monetize business podcasts for the LinkedIn Podcast Network  —  iHeartMedia is making a move to expand its role in business podcasting, signing a deal with professional social network LinkedIn.  —  The companies said LinkedIn's …

item.title: ベラルーシ、RFE/RLに寄稿していた著名ジャーナリスト、イハール・カルネイを逮捕。
item.description:
Associated Press:
Belarus arrests Ihar Karnei, a prominent journalist who has previously written for RFE/RL; a total of 36 journalists are behind bars in Belarus  —  Ihar Karnei was detained and his apartment raided with police seizing phones and computers, according to his daughter

item.title: ハリウッドのストライキはタレントと旧来のスタジオを対立させ、インターネットは配信を実質的に無料にし、希少性をなくすことで両グループを脅かす（Ben Thompson/Stratechery）
item.description:
Ben Thompson / Stratechery:
The Hollywood strike pits talent against old-line studios while the internet threatens both groups by making distribution effectively free and no longer scarce  —  From the New York Times: … Oh, I'm sorry — that's an article from 63 years ago.  —  Here's the one in the New York Times from last week:

item.title: Netflixが米国と英国で最も手頃な月額10ドルの広告なしベーシック・ティアーを撤廃し、新規および再加入の会員に広告なしの月額10.99ポンドまたは15.49ドルを請求する（あるいはGoren/Cord Busters）。
item.description:
Or Goren / Cord Busters:
Netflix removes its most affordable $10/month ad-free Basic tier in the US and UK, charging new and rejoining members £10.99/month or $15.49/month for no ads  —  Breaking: In a major shakeup of its pricing model, Netflix, the global streaming giant, has abandoned its low-cost ‘Basic’ tier …

item.title: ダン・ウートンは「過去に判断ミスを犯した」と語り、性的なネタで男性に金銭を提供したという主張はGBニュースを貶めるためのキャンペーンだったと示唆した（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
Dan Wootton says he made “errors of judgment in the past” and suggests the claims he offered men money for sexual material were a campaign to undermine GB News  —  GB News presenter facing allegations he inappropriately offered colleagues large sums in return for sexual material

item.title: リーチ・グループのロイド・エンブリーEICが約30年間在籍した出版社を退任、リーチの編集者は「運営上の問題」をジム・ミューレンCEOに直属する（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Reach group EIC Lloyd Embley steps down after about 30 years with the publisher; Reach's editors will report directly “on operational matters” to CEO Jim Mullen  —  Lloyd Embley has been group editor-in-chief at Reach since 2014.  —  Reach group editor-in-chief Lloyd Embley …
